benak.tomas.crimemonitor.client

Class CrimeActivityBase<CrimeData extends UtvarAndIntervalBasedCrimeSummary & java.io.Serializable>

  • java.lang.Object
    • Activity
      • benak.tomas.crimemonitor.client.CrimeActivityBase<CrimeData>
  • Type Parameters:
    CrimeData -
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    CrimeDataLoadingListener<CrimeData>, KodUtvaruLoadingListener, SelectCrimeDateIntervalDialogFragment.SelectCrimeDateIntervalDialogFragmentExceptionHandler, SelectCrimeDateIntervalDialogFragment.SelectCrimeDateIntervalDialogListener
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CrimeDetailActivity, CrimesListActivity, CrimeSummaryActivity, UtvarDetailActivity

    public abstract class CrimeActivityBase<CrimeData extends UtvarAndIntervalBasedCrimeSummary & java.io.Serializable>
extends Activity
implements SelectCrimeDateIntervalDialogFragment.SelectCrimeDateIntervalDialogListener, CrimeDataLoadingListener<CrimeData>, SelectCrimeDateIntervalDialogFragment.SelectCrimeDateIntervalDialogFragmentExceptionHandler, KodUtvaruLoadingListener
    CrimeActivityBase is the abstract base class for all the activities that need to handle the crime data.

    This activity tracks and displays the current department code and name. It displays them in the its title.

    It receives notifications about the current department code and name.

    It is able to request a reload of the department code and name for the current location.

    It is able to request a reload of the crime data for the current department. It is able to request a reload of the crime data for the crime data interval and the current department. The user usually selects the crime data interval and requests the department code reload.

    It is able to receive the department and crime data loading callbacks and handle errors, the loading cancellation, empty result. It also can display the returned data in an abstract way. The subclasses define the actual crime data type and how to display it.

    The activity is able to react to the background tasks lifecycle events like the task creation and ending, and display and hide the progres bar when there is an instance of a background task running. It also locks the appropriate UI components when there is any background task running.

    When a callback method of CrimeDataLoadingListener is called, the activity decides whether to display a progress bar and lock the appropriate UI components like options menu items.

    On data loading error it displays the alert dialog with the error details and logs the error.

    When an empty result is returned, the special view for the empty data is displayed.

    When the user clicks the back button, the activity stops all of the data loading tasks.

    The activity offers the options menu with the links to other data loading activities.

    The activity maintains its state and the currently loaded department code, name and crime data. It saves it in the case of the forced stop by the system when the activity might get killed due to the system's need to free the resources. It can restore the saved state afterwards if it had been previously saved. It can read the configuration parameters from the config file, like CrimeMonitor service base URL, initial crime data interval, department code and name.

    It transfers the needed parameters to other activities through the Intent instance that are to be launched from this activity. It can read the passed parameters from the passed Intent instance.

    It enables the user to display the crime data interval selection dialog and request the crime data load for the selected crime data interval.

    For department and crime data loading it uses a dedicated instance of CrimeDataLoadingFragment. The activity uses this fragment with the calls to its CrimeDataLoadingFragment.refreshDataIfLocationHasChanged and CrimeDataLoadingFragment.refreshDataForInterval to request the department and crime data loading. It then receives the callbacks as a KodUtvaruLoadingListener and CrimeDataLoadingListener. It can register the fragment to start listening to location updates with CrimeDataLoadingFragment.requestLocationUpdates and stop the listening with CrimeDataLoadingFragment.removeUpdates.

    Author:
    Tom
    See Also:
    CrimeDataLoadingFragment, CrimeDataLoadingListener, KodUtvaruLoadingListener, SelectCrimeDateIntervalDialogFragment.SelectCrimeDateIntervalDialogListener, SelectCrimeDateIntervalDialogFragment.SelectCrimeDateIntervalDialogFragmentExceptionHandler, UtvarAndIntervalBasedCrimeSummary

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • mCrimeDataLoadingFragment

        protected CrimeDataLoadingFragment<CrimeData extends UtvarAndIntervalBasedCrimeSummary & java.io.Serializable> mCrimeDataLoadingFragment
        the CrimeDataLoadingFragment instance.

        This object loads the department and crime data on behalf of this activity.

        There only is one such object per this activity and it only serves this activity.

        This fragment is retained across multiple activity instances of this class. For example, during the configuration change such as the screen rotation, the fragment is retained, not stopped and destroyed with its owning activity, only detached and reatached to a new activity instance, when the screen rotation is finished. This way the background tasks can keep running independently of the owning activity configuraion changes.

        See Also:
        CrimeDataLoadingFragment

        Constant Field Values

      • mStartYear

        protected int mStartYear
        initial crime data interval year

        Crime data interval

        It is meant to represent a real-world time interval.

        This interval starts with a certain initial month (mStartMonth) in a certain initial year (mStartYear) and ends with a certain terminal month (mEndMonth) in a certain terminal year ( mEndYear). Thus it includes the time period between the two months.

        This time period is used to filter the crimes according to the date and time of their occurence.

      • mStartYear_InstanceStateKey

      • onBackPressed

        public void onBackPressed()
        Standard Activity#onBackPressed override.

        When this method is called and any background task is running in CrimeDataLoadingFragment, it is cancelled.

      • onCreate

        protected void onCreate(Bundle savedInstanceState)
        Override of the standard Activity#onCreate lifecycle callback.

        If there is no instance state to be restored, the activity reads its state with readInstanceState(). If a ConfigurationErrorException is thrown during the instance state reading, it is caught and the situation is considered unrecoverable and the activity finishes.

        If there is instance state to be restored, the activity tries to restore it with restoreInstanceStateVariables(Bundle). If a ConfigurationErrorException is thrown during the instance state reading, it is caught and the situation is considered unrecoverable and the activity finishes.

        Then the content view is set, the views are set up, the crime data loading fragment is set up.

        Parameters:
        savedInstanceState - the bundle with the saved activity's dynamic state
        See Also:
        ConfigurationErrorException

      • onCreateOptionsMenu

      • onOptionsItemSelected

        public boolean onOptionsItemSelected(MenuItem item)
        Handles the options menu item selection.

        As a result, either the crime is refreshed, the crime data interval selection dialog is displayed or the used is navigated to a different activity to display an alternative crime statistics view.

      • onPause

        protected void onPause()
        Standard Activity#onPause override.

        Listening for location updates is turned off for CrimeDataLoadingFragment. Background tasks in CrimeDataLoadingFragment are cancelled.

      • onPrepareOptionsMenu

        public boolean onPrepareOptionsMenu(Menu menu)

      • onResume

        protected void onResume()
        Standard Activity#onResume override.

        Listening for location updates is turned on for CrimeDataLoadingFragment.

      • onSaveInstanceState

        protected void onSaveInstanceState(Bundle outState)
        Standard callback override of Activity#onSaveInstanceState.

        Saves the instance state for this activity as well as the loaded crime data.

        Parameters:
        outState - the Bundle with the saved state

      • onStart

        protected void onStart()
        Standard Activity#onStart override.

        When called, decides whether to display the loaded data, or an empty result view, or an empty screen if no data had been loaded yet.

        CrimeDataLoadingFragment is requested to reload the department code and name for the current location.

      • onStop

        protected void onStop()
        Standard Activity#onStop override.

        When this callback is called and it is not due to a configuration change, the CrimeDataLoadingFragment tasks are cancelled.

      • putExtrasForActivity

        protected void putExtrasForActivity(Bundle extras)
        Puts the parameters into a Bundle extras object to be used by an activity to be launched.
        Parameters:
        extras - the bundle extras object to be used by an activity to be launched

      • readDefaultInstanceState

        protected void readDefaultInstanceState()
                                 throws ConfigurationErrorException
        Reads the default instance state for this activity.

        The config file is the file ./assets/config.properties. If IOException occurs when reading the config file, it gets caught and ConfigurationErrorException is thrown.

        Throws:
        ConfigurationErrorException - if IOException occurs when reading the config file
        See Also:
        readDefaultInstanceStateFromConfigFile(java.util.Properties), IOException, ConfigurationErrorException

      • readDefaultInstanceStateFromConfigFile

        protected void readDefaultInstanceStateFromConfigFile(java.util.Properties configFile)
                                               throws ConfigurationErrorException
        Reads the default instance state for this activity from the config file.

        The CrimeMonitor servuce base URL is loaded from the config file, other instance state variables are assigned hard-coded values.

        Parameters:
        configFile - the Properties instance as a handle to the config file
        Throws:
        ConfigurationErrorException - if mServiceBaseUrl could not be loaded

      • readInstanceState

        protected void readInstanceState()
                          throws ConfigurationErrorException
        Loads the activity's instance state.

        If this activity is the launcher activity, then the default instance state is loaded (typically from the config file). Otherwise this activity tries to load the state from its Intent.

        Throws:
        ConfigurationErrorException - if configuration error of any kind occurs
        See Also:
        ConfigurationErrorException, Intent

      • readInstanceStateFromIntent

                                    throws ConfigurationErrorException
        Tries to read the instance state for this activity from the Intent extras.
        Parameters:
        extras - the Bundle with the extras to load the instance state variables from
        Throws:
        ConfigurationErrorException - if mServiceBaseUrl could not be loaded

      • updateOptionsMenuLockStateDueToDataLoading

        private void updateOptionsMenuLockStateDueToDataLoading()
        Updates the options menu according to the current running state of the department code and crime data loading task.

      • updateOptionsMenuLockStateDueToDataLoading

        protected void updateOptionsMenuLockStateDueToDataLoading(Menu menu)
        Updates the options menu according to the current running state of the background tasks.

        If there is an instance of the department data loading task or an instance of the crime data loading task, some options menu items get disabled.

        Parameters:
        menu - the options menu instance for this activity
